newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Eurostat says no ruling on German gold until law.
newsitem.headline: Eurostat says no ruling on German gold until law.

text.p: Eurostat, the European Commission's accounting arm, said on Friday it would have no ruling whether a German proposal to revalue gold would pass muster for qualifying for the single currency until it became law.

In a written answer to a question from Reuters, the Luxembourg-based agency noted that it had previously ruled that the sale of gold was a "financial transaction" which did not directly reduce public deficits.

"Concerning the problems of the revaluation of gold reserves by the German central bank, Eurostat is aware of a project for a law reform of the statute of the Bundebank, which foresees a more market oriented valuation of the gold reserves," it said.

"However, the details of this law have not been decided. Eurostat will take a decision, if necessary, only after the approval of this law and when all the details of the transactions connected to thsi law will be known," the letter said.
